body.name: VESTA Self-Powered Camping Indoor/Outdoor Heater & Stove (Compact, Off-Grid, Emergency)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 4 hrs 30 mins
features: No Electricity Required: Heat a Room and Cook without Power
Off-Grid Stove Heater: Great for Camping, Picnic, Emergency or Indoor Heating and Cooking
Compact & Portable: Weighs only 7.6 pounds! Easy to transport. Product Dimensions: 11"D x 7.5"W x 10.75"H
Warms Up To 200 SQ FT with Heat Powered Fan

Fueled by Canned Heat (3 Included): Safe for Indoor Use. *Canned heat is chafing fuel—odorless, smokeless, nontoxic, and generally safe for indoor use. It is still HIGHLY recommended to provide adequate ventilation in any room where it is in use.
Built-in Stove: Cook Food or Boil Water
An Emergency Doesn't need to be a Disaster!

Holds up to 3 Canned Heat (The Insta-Fire Vesta Stove Includes 3 cans) *** Shelf Life Insta-Fire Canned Heat: When stored in ambient conditions above its freezing point, this product will last for many years. Product may freeze when temperature reaches 16 degrees Fahrenheit (-8 Celsius).

Easy to transport.Measures 11" L x 7.5" W x 5.25" H when used as a stove.Measures 11" L x 7.5" W x 10.75" H when used as a heater.Won’t reveal your LOCATION.Indoors Space heater warms up 200 square feet!

productInformation.name: Care instructions
productInformation.value: Place the grate and heater-fan unit inside the outer casing for long-term storage the same way it came in the original packaging., With a cloth or paper towel, wipe clean the InstaFire VESTA Self-Powered Indoor Space Heater and Stove after every use.

productInformation.name: Power Source Includes 3 Canned Heat; Ensure Wick 1/4" to 1/2" Top Of Each Can; Can #1 Slot 1 Below The Fan See more

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Vesta Heater Stove Combo 3 Cans Lit & Ready to Push Into Vesta to Heat or Cook Pull Out TrayUnscrew The Lid Off Each CanLight Each Wick (Before lighting, ensure Each Wick Is About 1/4" to 1/2" From Top Off Each Can.Place the 3 Cans Included with Your Vesta Onto The TrayIf Only Using One Can, Ensure That Can Is In Slot 1 Below The FanCarefully Push The Tray Into Your VestaThe Fan Turns on Automatically… Just Give It a Few Minutes The Vesta Stove Heater Consolidates Two Essential Camping Tools Into One Compact: Carry in Your Car, Home, RV, Camper for Emergency Heating & Cooking! COOK AND HEAT indoors! (Cook Outdoors Too!)Use up to three cans (Included!) of canned heat at the same time.SAFE to use INDOORS when used with InstaFire 6-Hour Canned Heat Plus! (Included!)Weighs only 7.6 pounds! Easy to transport.Measures 11" L x 7.5" W x 5.25" H when used as a stove.Measures 11" L x 7.5" W x 10.75" H when used as a heater.Won’t reveal your LOCATION.Indoors Space heater warms up 200 square feet!

VESTA! Power Off and No Way to Cook? Not Anymore! From InstaFire, it's a convenient stove for cooking your meals that’s ALSO an indoor space heater! When you need to stay unseen but the power is out, outdoor cooking can be tough. Campfires force you outdoors, plus they give off smoke and light that will reveal your location. You need a SAFE and DISCREET way to cook indoors and outdoors to combat any emergency situation. Introducing the VESTA Self-Powered Indoor Space Heater & Stove by InstaFire! Power up the VESTA with up to three cans of InstaFire 6-Hour Canned Heat Plus and cook away with minimal smoke and flames that won’t alert everyone to your position. Using this stove with canned heat also makes it SAFE TO USE INDOORS, giving you the option to cook indoors and outdoors. Plus, the stove features a convenient nested design, allowing the top piece to be easily stored inside the bottom piece. This space-saving feature ensures that the stove remains compact and easy to store or transport, making it perfect for camping trips or emergency situations. The VESTA gives you the adaptability and reliability to deal with the unexpected, particularly where Mother Nature is concerned. So, whether you are embracing the spontaneous nature of camping adventures or dealing with the unpredictability of disasters, you’ll always have a way to cook your food and stay warm indoors and outdoors.

VESTA doubles as a heater! The VESTA’s dual-purpose design is more than just useful. It consolidates two essential camping tools into one, saving valuable space and simplifying your outdoor experience.Warm an indoor space up to 200 square feet in size without the need for electricity.With reliability, safety, and its self-powering capabilities, the VESTA stove offers a sense of freedom and autonomy, allowing you to cook meals and stay warm even in remote locations that don't offer access to traditional power sources.Whether you need to bug out or bunker up, the VESTA will keep you WELL-FED and WARM. The fan motor operates on heat and must absorb enough of it in order to run. It takes up to three minutes for the fan to begin spinning. It takes another five to eight minutes to reach its full speed and emit maximum heat. At that point, the fan will blow four miles per hour, just like a small electric space heater!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Staying warm and able to cook if the grid goes down !
reviews.reviewText: Tried this product it worked perfectly and was very easy to use ! We must prepare for possibilities !!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Clever Dual Use Design
reviews.reviewText: So far this purchase has worked out well. Used it in power outage for cooking, and used it days later when our heating unit failed during really cold weather. When using this for heat, it's only going to cover a small area, but it is effective.Both with cooking and with heating, I used all 3 burners.Love the design, easy to set up and use in emergency.Would purchase again,

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Kept me and my dogs from dying
reviews.reviewText: This is a fantastic product that kept us from freezing to death during 4 days without power during an icestorm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It does a good job heating.
reviews.reviewText: Works very well. The provided snuffer is not up to the task and had to purchase a separate one that could cover the can opening to put the fire much better. Watch out for sharp edges!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keeps Us From Freezing
reviews.reviewText: I live in the Rocky Mountains and we have lost power twice this winter when the temperature outside was -15 Fahrenheit. I use this stove to keep the upstairs room from being frigid and to keep the pipes from freezing. It doesn’t give off a ton of heat but it’s better than nothing in a part of the house without a wood burning stove.I moved here from NYC last spring and felt a little silly buying this stove in the middle of summer but I’m so glad I did. I have a few extra cans of fuel too as this stove comes only with three cans. Better to feel silly and be prepared then stuck in a blackout in the middle of winter without heat. I haven’t used it to cook. Yet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Got this to add to my emergency stash…after three straight years of some kind of weather disaster I need something to be able to heat up soup or make a cup of coffee while sheltering in place. Was well packaged and appears to be well made. I have high hopes for this stove.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This heater will keep you warm
reviews.reviewText: love this unit, kept a four-person tent very comfortable at 19 degrees outside and 68 degrees inside (as shown in photo, taken at coldest part of trip). like the use of canned heat instead of propane, no smell and no chance of explosive gas leaks. Having a built-in fan is a very nice feature, and the added cooking function makes this unit a vital piece of equipment for tent camping or to keep around for any emergency like power outages or inclement weather. Makes winter camping bearable even comfortable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Did not come with canned heat
reviews.reviewText: I got this for emergency heat.My item did not have any canned heat included. Either the product listing is wrong or it was not shipped. Amazon support had to give partial refund as I really wanted the item.The item works great as a heater. For cooking it needs to be small dishes or small amounts of water to boil. I won't use it for cooking just a heater.I am using cheap canned heat from local store so I don't know if the included cans are hotter or not. I did notice that if I pulled the wick out a little more the fire will get hotter but burns fuel faster. I will order the insta canned heat to see if theirs makes a difference.

It works! It's a great addition. It was extremely cold (-20C outside) The central heating system couldn't keep up with the extreme temperature. This small unit raised the temperature to a comfortable temp. Of course, it's a small unit. It won't replace a central heating system but it will help.
This little thing helped keep things above freezing. I was comfortable. I survived the arctic cold we had that lasted a week. For small spaces. I recommend it. Even for van lifers. It saved my life.

I've been waiting for quite some time to get this little gem! And last week was cold enough in the house to test it out. It comes with three tins of "fancy heat" but for testing I just used two of the ones I got from the dollar store. And we only tested the heater.It did not take long for the fan to start turning, and we did notice a difference, the room was a little warmer. But as I said, it was dollar store canned heat and only two of them, and one was already half used up.So the test was positive, and next I'm going to try my stove top coffee pot on it to see how long that takes. We had a 24 hour power outage a few years ago when we lived in BC, and it was a nightmare to wake up and realize we weren't getting any coffee!!! And I suppose while I'm waiting for the coffee pot, I'll try cooking an egg.I would definitely recommend this to anyone, especially since you are able to use it indoors. It's not heavy, but is sturdy. This is one item I have no regrets about purchasing!

I tried to heat an insulated campervan with this Vesta heater; it couldn't raise the temp by more than 1.5-2 degrees celcius, and most of that was just my body heat; The entire mechanism that sits on top of the grill seems to just absorb most of heat the sterno cans give off. The fumes were bad, had to leave a window cracked, which let 100% of the heat it produces right out the window. Takes 45 mins to boil water. The stainless grill seems to be of a high quality, the rest is just stamped and riveted and coated sheet metal. Definitely not worth the $260 I paid. Thankfully it's being refunded.
